TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in Gföhl . He was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government were represented by their Agent , Ambassador PERSON , Head of the International PERSON at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the mayor of Gföhl granted the applicant ’s neighbours a building permit for a house and a garage , whereby the latter was to be situated on the border of the applicant ’s property . The applicant ’s appeals were to no avail and the proceedings were terminated by ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE .

Further proceedings in which the applicant had contested his obligation to allow his neighbours to enter upon his land in order to enable them to construct the garage remained unsuccessful and were terminated by ORG decision of DATE . Subsequently , proceedings to enforce the applicant ’s obligation were conducted .

On DATE the applicant requested the Gföhl municipality to issue a demolition order for his ORG garage . He submitted , in particular , that the garage had not been constructed in accordance with the requirements of the building permit as regards fire protection measures .
On DATE the mayor of Gföhl dismissed the applicant ’s request .
On DATE the applicant ’s appeal was dismissed by ORG .

On DATE ORG , upon the applicant ’s objection , quashed ORG decision and referred the case back to it , finding that it had failed to establish the relevant facts as regards the question whether deviations from the building permit impeded the fire resistance of the garage at issue .
On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint against ORG decision , alleging in particular that the reasons given indicated that his request was unfounded .
On DATE ORG , without holding a hearing , dismissed the applicant ’s complaint against ORG decision . It noted that , in any case , the reasons given for a decision were not binding .

On DATE ORG carried out an inspection of the garage in presence of an expert for building matters but in absence of the applicant . A report was drawn up by the expert , finding that the garage ’s outer wall was fire resistant . Subsequently , on DATE , ORG again dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE ORG , upon the applicant ’s objection , quashed ORG decision and referred the case back to it , finding that it had failed to give the applicant an opportunity to comment on the report of the inspection carried out on DATE .

On DATE the applicant ’s counsel , on whom ORG had served the report of DATE , submitted written observations . He submitted in particular that the expert ’s submissions contained in the report did not meet the basic requirements of an expert opinion .

On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG , claiming that the decision of CARDINAL DATE was arbitrary and that the reasons given for it showed that ORG considered his request to be unfounded .
On DATE ORG refused to deal with the applicant ’s complaint for lack of prospects of success and transferred the case to ORG .
On DATE ORG , without holding a hearing , dismissed the applicant ’s complaint against ORG decision of DATE .
On DATE ORG again dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s objection . It found in essence that the outer wall of the garage was fire - resistant . As it had not been constructed in contravention of the building permit , there was no basis for issuing a demolition order .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint for lack of prospects of success and transferred the case to ORG .

On DATE the applicant supplemented his complaint to ORG and requested that an oral hearing be held . He complained about the duration of the proceedings . As to their merits , he maintained that his ORG garage did not comply with the relevant provisions on fire - resistance . Further , he complained that he had not been present at the inspection of the garage on DATE and that the expert opinion was not conclusive . Moreover , he challenged all members of the competent chamber of ORG for bias .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s motion for bias .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint as being unfounded . Furthermore , ORG refused the applicant ’s request for an oral hearing , relying on section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW which allows it to forego a hearing if it is not likely to contribute to the clarification of the case .

The court noted that the applicant ’s neighbours had a final building permit , which he could no longer challenge . As regards the applicant ’s complaint about the duration of the proceedings it noted that the proceedings concerning the issuing of the building permit and the proceedings concerning his request for a demolition order were to be regarded separately . The latter proceedings had not yet lasted unreasonably long .

As to the applicant ’s request for a demolition order , the court noted that the report of the inspection of DATE had been duly served on the applicant who had commented thereon . Consequently , the fact that he had not been summoned to participate in the inspection did not constitute a procedural defect . Furthermore , the authority ’s finding that the garage ’s outer wall was fire - resistant was based on a conclusive expert opinion . Consequently , ORG confirmed ORG view that the garage complied with the building permit . ORG decision was served on DATE .
In connection with the above proceedings , the applicant conducted CARDINAL sets of proceedings under LAW .

On DATE the applicant filed an action with ORG , claiming that the NORP municipality had acted unlawfully in that it had failed to summon him to the inspection of DATE and requesting lawyer ’s costs incurred for the appeal against the ensuing decision . The court held a hearing on DATE . A further hearing was postponed once on the defendant ’s request and once on the applicant ’s request and was finally held on DATE . On DATE ORG granted the applicant ’s action on the merits but reduced the amount claimed by MONEY . The decision was served on DATE .

In a further set of proceedings started on DATE the applicant claimed costs incurred on account of the allegedly unlawful decisions of ORG . On DATE ORG found that it did not have jurisdiction to deal with the case and transferred it to ORG . The latter , after having received submissions from both parties , held a hearing on DATE . On DATE the ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . The decision was served on DATE .

In DATE , proceedings concerning the possible appointment of a guardian for the applicant were instituted by ORG . They were discontinued on DATE after the court had established that the applicant did not need the assistance of a guardian .
